entities.name: morfin
entities.description: Morfin is the father of Tom and Merope, as mentioned in the text. He is described as getting out of his armchair and speaking in Parseltongue.

entities.name: tom
entities.description: Tom is the son of Morfin and Merope, as mentioned in the text. He is described as not being right in the head by his father.

entities.name: merope
entities.description: Merope is the daughter of Morfin and the sister of Tom, as mentioned in the text. She is described as being white and on the verge of fainting.

entities.name: gaunt
entities.description: Gaunt is likely a surname for Morfin, as he is referred to as 'Mr. Gaunt' in some contexts. In this text, he is speaking in Parseltongue and looking at his son and daughter.

entities.name: parseltongue
entities.description: Parseltongue is a language spoken by wizards and magical creatures, as mentioned in the text. Morfin and Gaunt are speaking in Parseltongue to communicate with each other.

entities.name: cecilia
entities.description: Cecilia is a person who is being spoken to by her father, as mentioned in the text. She is referred to as 'darling' and is advised not to look at something.
